description:
Implement Proper Sibling Relationship Management in Family Tree

Fix and enhance the sibling linking system to correctly establish and display family relationships based on shared parentage.

Requirements:

**Core Functionality:**
- Automatically link all siblings who share the same parent(s) when a new child is created
- Display all sibling relationships correctly in the tree view
- Require both parents to be specified when creating a child from a parent node
- Add parent selection interface in the configuration when creating a child

**Relationship Types to Support:**
- Full siblings: Children sharing both biological parents
- Half siblings: Children sharing exactly one biological parent
- Step siblings: Children with no shared biological parents but whose parents are partnered

**Specific Fixes:**
- Debug why newly created siblings are not auto-linking to existing siblings
- Resolve tree view rendering issue that prevents siblings from appearing
- Implement bidirectional sibling relationship updates (when A is added as sibling to B, B should automatically link to A)

**Data Integrity:**
- Validate that each child record references exactly two parent records
- Update existing single-parent child records to require second parent selection
- Prevent creation of child nodes without both parents specified

**Edge Cases to Handle:**
- Adding children to families with existing children
- Modifying parent relationships for existing children
- Orphaned nodes (if parent information is incomplete)
- Distinguishing between different sibling types in the UI
title: Implement sibling relationship linking in family tree
